participant_abstract.sent: Our final meeting was half-an-hour long.
Heather started things off, and then the prototype was presented.
Poppy and Tara created a remote that is shaped like a small mango (taking off from the fashionable fruit trend) and the numbers are in a circle around it.
It is easy to hold, unique and would come in many different colour schemes.
After their presentation, I walked us through the marketing product evaluation.
I came up with 11 questions based on the goals that we made for ourselves in the functional and conceptual meetings.
The group discussed each question and decided on a score based on a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 is true and 7 is false.
Our average score was 1.9, which is quite good (see Marketing- Final Evaluation in the Projects Folder) .
Heather presented the Finance report, and we were pleased to see that we were just below are allowable budget of 12.50 Euros at 12.20.
Our final project evaluation was that we were succesful in creating a remote control that we believe will be welcomed by the public.

participant_actions.sent: It's out of our hands now.... we'll leave it up to the engineers!

participant_decisions.sent: Will replace the + sign in the middle of the ring of numbers with an Enter button .
Logo should be less glaring, either smaller or different colour .
We can implement different face plates later on if the remote is successful.
The marketing scheme will have to stress the simplicity of the remote (only power, channel and volume buttons!).
The marketing scheme will have to stress the efficiency of the kinetic energy source (be good to the environment and save money on batteries!).
The marketing scheme will have to promote the trendiness of the product and emphasize the RR motto of "putting the fashion into electronics!"

participant_problems.sent: The buttons kept on falling off.
The designers felt they lacked materials (more playdough colours would have been appreciated).
The alarm is an interior aspect so we could not see it/evaluate it.
Never truly resolved the 'smart materials' environmental issue.
